Yes, here are some examples of successful cross-industry collaborations between healthcare and technology companies:

1. Apple and Aetna: Apple and Aetna partnered to promote the use of Apple Watches to track and measure health data like physical activity, sleep, and heart rate. Aetna offered subsidies to its members to buy an Apple Watch and use it with its wellness program. This partnership allowed Aetna to encourage its members to lead a healthier lifestyle while incorporating technology.

2. Google and Novartis: Google and Novartis developed smart contact lenses that measure glucose levels in the tears of patients with diabetes. The contact lenses have tiny sensors and an antenna that can send data wirelessly to a mobile device. This collaboration allowed Novartis to develop innovative products while leveraging Google's technology expertise.

3. IBM and Pfizer: IBM and Pfizer partnered to use artificial intelligence (AI) to develop new drugs that can treat diseases. IBM's AI technology was used to analyze vast amounts of data to identify new drug candidates that were then tested by Pfizer. This collaboration allowed Pfizer to speed up its drug discovery process while leveraging IBM's technology expertise.

4. Microsoft and Adaptive Biotechnologies: Microsoft and Adaptive Biotechnologies partnered to develop a blood test that can diagnose diseases like multiple sclerosis and cancer at an early stage. Microsoft's AI technology was used to analyze the immune system's response to various diseases, leading to the creation of a diagnostic blood test. This collaboration allowed Adaptive Biotechnologies to develop innovative product offerings while leveraging Microsoft's technology expertise.

5. Philips and Banner Health: Philips and Banner Health collaborated to build a remote intensive care unit (ICU) that allows doctors to monitor ICU patients from a remote location. The system uses Philips' technology to capture real-time data on patient vital signs, and doctors can evaluate and intervene as needed. This collaboration helped Banner Health expand its telemedicine offerings while leveraging Philips' technology expertise.
